pullRequest.body:
There is now a (good) diamond of files `Order.Hom.Basic -> .Bounded, .Lattice -> .BoundedLattice` containing the declarations for order maps and lattice homomorphisms.

Results on adjoining `⊤` and `⊥` are now in `Order.Hom.WithTopBot`. The latter file is also populated with `WithTop/WithBot`-containing declarations from `Order.Hom.Basic`.

* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

bors r+
Nice work! I think unbounded/bounded is indeed the right way to split this file. I have some comments on the precise way to split but overall I am quite happy with how this turned out.

Thank you, very nice work!

bors r+

Should the remainder of this section, covering `BotHomClass`/`TopHomClass`, not also be moved to `Hom.BoundedLattice`?

More generally: which declarations in this file still require the import of `Hom.Bounded`?
After tinkering with it a bit the structure became clear; see new PR description.
Did you try also moving definitions like `OrderHom.withTopMap` here? The name of this file suggests that it should not only be restricted to lattices.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: split `Order.Hom.Lattice`
